intro: Adenandra umbellata var. speciosa, commonly known as the showy adenandra, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of bright yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Adenandra umbellata var. speciosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
